summary: This bill, the "Prohibiting Automatic Rights to Enter National Territory Act of 2025" (PARENT Act of 2025), introduced in the House of Representatives, aims to clarify birthright citizenship. It proposes amending the Immigration and Nationality Act to define "subject to the jurisdiction thereof" in relation to individuals born in the United States, specifying that it applies to those born to a U.S. citizen or a lawful permanent resident. The changes would apply to persons born after the bill's enactment.
